page.title: 01THE ALKHAM VALLEY AREA
page.content: At the centre of our area lies the village of Alkham,surrounded by isolated farms,cottages and to the north the neighbouring hamlet of Ewell Minnis.The village is divided by the busy B2060 Dover to Folkestone road. The population of Alkham village in 1976 was 140 but the parish of Alkham contains nearly four times this. The scattered community is involved with agriculture,mainly arable and sheep farming.The working population of Alkham is employed in Dover or Folkestone but a large proportion of the villagers, most of whom have lived there for many years,have retired. Services within the village are limited but villagers prefer to enjoy the rural setting of Alkham in its wide valley rather than move into neighbouring towns.The village lies in a Conservation Area.
